required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on December 16, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Phase 2 Study to Evaluate the Safety, PK, and Exploratory PD of Tildacerfont in Children With CAH
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2 Study to Evaluate the Safety, Pharmacokinetics, and Exploratory Pharmacodynamics of SPR001 (Tildacerfont) in Children Aged 6 to 17 Years With Congenital Adrenal Hyperplasia

brief_summary.textblock: An investigation of the safety of Tildacerfont in pediatric subjects with CAH.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a study to evaluate the safety of Tildacerfont in pediatric subjects with CAH. Treatment will consist of 14 days of continuous dosing followed by safety follow up.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Subjects will be assigned to treatment cohorts by age.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with TEAE as assessed by CTAE version 5
primary_outcome.description: To evaluate safety of tildacerfont in pediatric subjects with CAH as measured by number of subjects with adverse events following dosing by CTAE version 5

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve (AUC)
secondary_outcome.description: To determine the pharmacokinetics (PK) of tildacerfont in pediatric subjects with CAH as measured by area under the plasma concentration versus time curve (AUC) of tildacerfont following dosing

secondary_outcome.measure: Acceptability assessed using a 5-point hedonic scale following dosing
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the acceptability of the granule formulation of tildacerfont in pediatric subjects using a 5-point hedonic scale following dosing

secondary_outcome.measure: Palatability (smell taste, texture) assessed using a 5-point hedonic scale following dosing
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the palatability of the granule formulation of tildacerfont in pediatric subjects using a 5-point hedonic scale to compare the product smell, taste, mouth feel following dosing

arm_group.description: Oral Tildacerfont administered daily for 14 consecutive days.
Oral Tildacerfont administered daily for 14 consecutive days.
Oral Tildacerfont administered daily for 14 consecutive days.

intervention.description: Oral granule formulation taken once daily in combination with glucocordicoid therapy.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male and female subjects aged 6 to 17 years
- Diagnosis of CAH due to 21-OHD and/or elevated 17-OHP requiring ongoing GC replacement since diagnosis
- Stable dose of GC replacement for at least 1 month prior to screening
Exclusion Criteria:
- CAH not due to 21-OHD
- History of bilateral adrenalectomy or hypopituitarism
- Current treatment with dexamethasone
- Clinically significant unstable medical conditions, illness, or chronic diseases
- History of active bleeding disorders
- Females who are pregnant or nursing
